website_summaries.verdict: The Rover is a traditional looking hiking shoe with a performance outsole.
pros: The outsole repels dirt and debris and provides plenty of traction
The durable hiking shoe is low to the ground, which helps keep wearers stable and features patented midsole cushioning for shock absorption
cons: we recommend going up a size

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and supportive
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous pair of these and walked 10 miles per day in them in Italy. They are adequately accommodating of my somewhat wide feet, and are very comfortable and supportive for me. The arch support initially felt a bit out of position on one side (due to my asymmetrical feet) , but the shoe seemed to adapt to that pretty quickly. The color in reality is not as light / bright as the picture. This does not concern me, but the picture is inaccurate in that respect. Otherwise, all is as I expected. I'm ordering another pair in black.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: That's a good shoe. The soles are rugged but not too ...
customer_reviews.text: I walk off trail for a living ... usually from 500-1000 miles a year. These shoes hold up in everything from Sierra talus to Mojave gravel to coastal sand. The pair I bought this year is still going, in Dec.?! That's a good shoe. The soles are rugged but not too stiff, and the leather has been resistant to wear. No complaints, considering how badly some shoes have failed me in the past.
customer_reviews.author: N Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all-around
customer_reviews.text: These are great for hiking! Traction is very good. they are very comfortable, and so far seem to be very rugged. I stepped in water a couple inches deep a few times and feet remained dry. They seem to keep my feet in a good position and don't allow too much bending in the middle as my prior hiking shoes did. My feet don't overheat in these shoes as they do in some other similar hiking shoes I've had, but they don't seem to get cold in cold weather either. I love them! When they wear out, I'll be looking to replace them with a new set that are the exact same brand and style.
customer_reviews.author: K. Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: What's up with the quality control, Merrell? I ...
customer_reviews.text: What's up with the quality control, Merrell? I used to swear by Merrell shoes, most of my trail running and hiking shoes were Merrell. I needed to replace two pairs recently, so I bought Merrell again. One pair's left shoe has something pressing hard against my arch. The other pair's right shoe had (I guess) extra material sewn in in of the stitches, so it rubbed painfully against my foot. I don't think I'll be buying Merrell online anymore -- hard to predict what you'll get.
customer_reviews.author: Pen_Name

customer_reviews.title: Dry and comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these shoes for a trip to the Rockies in November. Put many many miles on them through the ice and snow and my feet remained dry the whole time. And I wasn't timid about where I stepped. I did spend a couple of months breaking them in first, not that they were uncomfortable, but they were the only shoes I took on this trip so I needed them to be ready to roll. Now they fit so well and are so comfortable that I wear them almost daily in my home state of Florida. Very pleased in the investment.
customer_reviews.author: big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: These seemed a little bit narrow when I first put them on, not so bad that I wanted to send them back, but a little narrow. I realized I ordered 13W and meant to order 13EE. Considering, These fit pretty well.I like these shoes, They are well made and they have excellent treads, which was the main reason I was looking for new shoes. I'm happy with my buy. Update: 12/28/2017 These are still holding up after seven months. They don't feel as narrow anymore, probably wore in. I'm still happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Good Merican

customer_reviews.title: Wider than Average, but Good Shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Really love these shoes! I haven't worn them as much as some others, but I needed a different pair of hiking shoes for the upcoming summer. They tend to be wider than other shoes. Ordered wide, because I usually need to, and they were boats. Ordered regular for my size, and fit as expected, and perfectly wide. I recommend them for anyone looking for a versatile hiking shoe that can be worn out and about. Will update after the hiking season this summer. They should get a work out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, feels great
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, fits similar to same size ventilators. Haven't tested waterproof thoroughly, but they have kept me feet dry in the rain. The soles on these are great, durable and very anti slip. Plus they make shoes that fit my 14 foot. The toe box is wider than other competitors I have tried, Columbia for instance. My foot usually fits 14m for most shoe types as long as the toe box is not too narrow.
customer_reviews.author: MattR

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly practical, totally reliable, sturdy and versatile
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 pair and I love them. I guess they stopped making them, but they are water resistant with the proper, routinely applied, coatings. And they have very good traction in wet weather. They're a little heavier than sneakers or hiking shoes, but totally comfortable for wearing all day or travelling. They are better as outdoor shoes and I do not choose them on days I know I'll be doing heavy shopping or working in an office. But my job is 50% outside and for those days, these shoes are perfect. The are great with any casuals, canvas, work pants or jeans.
customer_reviews.author: realnamehere

customer_reviews.title: A bit disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Good looking shoes. Feel fine top and sides but fairly hard sole/bottom. I almost returned them but bought Dr Scholls inserts and now its fine. But, for the price (and brand) I should have had to do that. I bought them to take on a trip to Europe but can't risk sore feet over 10 days if use so will take my Sketchers instead and use these around town... too late to return. Thought I had purchased a 5 star shoe.. oh well
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Big & ugly in wide sizes
customer_reviews.text: If you order these in the wide size like I did, they won't look like sleek, rugged sneakers like in the product photos - they will look like the boots Frankenstein's monster wore in the classic movies. They look like bulbous, beastly orthopedic shoes. I have wide feet, but the toe boxes in these things are so big the front portion of my foot was moving around freely when they were tied snuggly.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi H. Radheshwar

customer_reviews.title: Falling Apart too Soon
customer_reviews.text: I agree with others. These shoes are very comfortable, look good, work well for hiking, and are versatile (function as shoe when going to restaurant or party). But they are falling apart sooner than expected. 4 months is not long enough for a shoe to last.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: Suits its purpose
customer_reviews.text: Finding wide shoes can be challenging. I would not recommend these unless you are putting in your own insoles however. Sturdy outside construction, nice soles, but the inside is garbage. Some weird interior stich decisions and sole attachment points make it a blister cornucopia. Significant improvement by putting in own insoles
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Cross

customer_reviews.title: Find that these are not as good a fit as my
customer_reviews.text: Hard to buy shoes on web! Had to order and return two pair before settling on these. These are same as shoe size but wider. Lots of room in toe box, but toes move close to front when walking down hill. Find that these are not as good a fit as my. Asics runners, and do not wear as well when walking. It seems that the sole of the shoe is a bit stiff, does not flex well and aggravates my foot that suffers from plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Sharratt

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best casual dress shoes I have ever owned. This is now the third pair of these shoes I have owned and will keep buying them as long as they are available. They look pretty good with both khaki's or jeans and can dress up a polo and blue-jeans. I wear them mostly in the winter when I walk and I have never taken a tumble. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: I would change nothing about these shoes, they are my favorite all-purpose shoes
customer_reviews.text: I just wore these for 2 weeks of walking and hiking through the rain in Ireland and Iceland, and my feet were dry the entire time. But I did spray these with Granger's Xtreme Repel Waterproofing Spray beforehand as added protection. The grip pattern on the bottom of the shoes was great to, and allowed me to scramble across rocks easily. And they are completely black, so I could where these out to dinner after walking through mud puddles all day. I would change nothing about these shoes, they are my favorite all-purpose shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit compare to other Merrill’s of same size/width
customer_reviews.text: This shoe does not fit like other Merrill shoes. Way to narrow compared to other Merrill shoes of same width and size. Would of sent them back but treated the leather prior to wearing them and trying to stretch them out. My bad
customer_reviews.author: Lynda Lundeby

customer_reviews.title: one Stars
customer_reviews.text: It sure seems like the insole cushion has lost its cush in 3 weeks. Now about 1 month the insoles are shot. $73 is a lot for a pair of shoes that are no longer wearable. Does Merrell offer any insole replacement deals? I wore them yesterday and it feels like my feet are bruised.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Scantlin

customer_reviews.title: merrell makes the best shoes ever.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of merrells. i dont like to spend a lot on clothes especially shoes but my previous pair of merrell's lasted over two years. I'm only replacing them because i had to super glue a tread back on as i've nearly worn them out from use. they're still great for working in the yard or backups. anyhow, with these new ones i paid 120 US and they are worth every penny. they look great, are just as light as my last hiking shoes, and these are a little better for walking on pavement since the soles are less hiking shoe more "all terrain".
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Jones

customer_reviews.title: good traction for hiking and good looking for casual shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: had these for about a month now and wearing almost daily. They will take a few days to break in but after this very comfy and stable shoe. good traction for hiking and good looking for casual shoe with jeans or khaki's. This is a warm shoe and I don't imagine wearing it in the summertime. I got this for a wintertime shoe in here in the north east. If you suffer from sweaty feet even in the winter, you may want to pick something else. They will keep your feet warm though if that's what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Eastbound

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but will fall apart within months
customer_reviews.text: These particular shoes are comfortable however I will have to concur with some of the low reviews out there; they did personally fall apart within a few months of use. I ended up going back to using an older pair of Merrell's I own that still are in otherwise excellent condition despite having several years on them.
customer_reviews.author: Alias-T

customer_reviews.title: NICE SOLID SHOE
customer_reviews.text: NICE SHOE.. Nice leather and support.. However, Shoes were ever so slightly smaller than, what I have thought of as "normal" size 8. (Maybe, if it was a wider variety it would've fit right)... and I wish the lugs on the sole were deeper, seems more like an "on the trail running shoe, more than an "off the trail hiking shoe"..
customer_reviews.author: RaphaelRicardo

customer_reviews.title: My go-to daily shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, my daily favorite. I even where them to the office because they go great with business casual and don't really look like sneakers. Have had them for a year and the only negative is that the front toe cover on one shoe has begun to pull apart but I'll probably be able to glue it back in place. Very comfortable, they fit my size 10M feet perfectly although I did remove the stock insole and use Heeku insoles instead.
customer_reviews.author: shelbygt350h

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes I own. Perfect for the city and the outdoors
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the most comfortable shoes I've purchased. I use them mostly for work and walking around the city, but love the aggressive sole and the fact that I can wear them pretty much anywhere. These shoes need no breaking in and are comfortable as soon as you try them. I don't know why I haven't purchased Merrells before but they are now my shoe of choice now! Great buy and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JuniorL

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable dress shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have both a waterproof pair and a non-waterproof pair of these. They are unbelievably comfortable. I stand for long periods of time wearing dress clothes and these shoes are superb for that. The non-waterproof version breathes fairly well. The waterproof version does make your feet sweat if you wear them for long periods of time, but they are excellent if you're walking in the rain, slush, or snow. Ideal winter shoes. You can wear these- brown or black-with dress clothes.
customer_reviews.author: David J Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: Look Good and Feel Great
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit good right out of the box. Have walked over 12 miles in a day and feet still feel good. They look better than my old vented hiking Moab Merrells although they do get hot because they are Not vented...... But what the H... they look good and feel good. Look more like a good casual shoe rather than the good hiking boot they are.
customer_reviews.author: Pout

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoe I own
customer_reviews.text: Probably the most comfortable shows I own - especially with the Dr. Scholls work gel insoles available from Amazon. I'm a size 9 and these shoes fit perfectly - like a glove - and are light and exceptionally good traction - Great for long walks or just around the yard. More of a suede finish than smooth leather so I use a suede cleaner to keep them clean - Color is about like the picture - no surprises.
customer_reviews.author: Bill - Seattle

customer_reviews.title: My favorite of several pairs of Merrell shoes purchased during last ...
customer_reviews.text: My favorite of several pairs of Merrell shoes purchased during last decade. Vibram sole, lots of support underneath and at the heel, double-stitching at all critical points, with soft leather above (not quite boot-grade, but otherwise would be a difficult break-in). The "kangaroo" color, which was available at a considerable discount, is less green and more brown that appears in the photo, which was expected. Will become more so after inevitable application of oil or wax leather conditioner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Happy feet!
customer_reviews.text: I am a school teacher and these are extremely comfortable for walking, kneeling, and generally being on my feet all day. Good traction for walking on rough terrain as well, although that is not why I purchased them. It is nice to know that they can comfortably handle a little ice and snow like what is left behind in a plowed parking lot.
customer_reviews.author: HH

customer_reviews.title: I like them, however using the size chart the shoes ...
customer_reviews.text: I like them, however using the size chart the shoes ended up being a bit big in the toe area. Other than that they were comfortable on the very first wear. I haven't worn them through water yet so I cannot honestly speak to how waterproof they actually are or are not. They are not hot and my feet have not gotten sweaty. Very nice and I will be purchasing again just a smaller width.
customer_reviews.author: BVJim

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are excellent
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are excellent. They fit perfectly out of the box, are broad enough for those that need slightly wider than D fit. I must agree with others however that they are a little hotter to wear than shoes that are ventilated, but you can't have water resistant and flow through ventilation. Leather uppers are smooth finished and have a quality look.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Gee

customer_reviews.title: Another great offering from Merrell
customer_reviews.text: Merrell has never failed to impress me with the quality footwear they produce. I have worn nothing but Merrell as my daily shoes (or sandals) for the past 10 years. These shoes display the quality that the company is known for. I like that these go with almost any outfit since they're a little less "athletic" looking than the Moab Ventilators I was wearing before I got these. I can take a decent walk through the woods and then come home, clean them off and be ready to go out and about. I've been wearing these for a few months and they've held up as expected. I'd highly recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Give these time!
customer_reviews.text: First I would have gave these shoes a 1 star review. It did take me about 48hrs+ to break them in. They killed my feet at first but after being broke in you can't find me with out them on. I bought them for my trip to italy,needless to say they stayed home and I went. When I got back I kept breaking them in and I love them now.water proof with some mink oil is a key also.
customer_reviews.author: Jbohn

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, but dont let it stay wet
customer_reviews.text: Stylish and comfortable, good all around walking and LIGHT hiking shoe. Wouldn't use it for hard core hiking or mudding. Recommend treating it with 3M or other waterproofing spray as when wet, tends to hold on to moisture. Would also leave it indoors to dry out thoroughly instead of leaving it outside on the porch as it will feel mildew that way.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Love all my Merrell's
customer_reviews.text: Love all my Merrell's, i wore these to a trip to DC where my home office is. If you have ever been it's all walking all the time. 20 min to the train 15 min from the train to the office. All over my building all day etc. There were basically new never worn and my feet felt great all day. I have never gone wrong with Merrell's (knock on wood) i have four pairs and my son has 2 and he is only 7
customer_reviews.author: Michael Orozco

customer_reviews.title: Sizing issue...
customer_reviews.text: I like the Moab Ventilator much better. Quality of shoe is good. I wore them about a month and they just never fit right. I donated them to charity. This is my first bad experience with Merrell and I have bought dozens of pairs of shoes from them. I will continue to buy shoes from Merrell. They work great for my pain issues. These were just not right for me.
customer_reviews.author: JTheod

customer_reviews.title: Fit is good. Comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: Fit is good. Comfortable shoes. These are the non waterproof shoes. Why pay more for the waterproof ones when all you have to do is give these a quick spray of boot water repellent. I am pretty sure that is what they do with the waterproof ones. Save some good money on these. Good shoe.
customer_reviews.author: dobie

customer_reviews.title: My every other day favorite
customer_reviews.text: These are some great shoes. I could tell the minute I slipped them on that I was going to like these for a long time. I wear them every other day for about 10 hours a day and I need the wide version. The width is important where my toes reside, and these are really nice and wide right there. If they weren't so expensive I would buy another pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Bucko43

customer_reviews.title: Not for extended use
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes for delivering mail. There is something about them that severely hurts my feet. They've been broken in for months but they still leave blisters on my heel. I think it has something to do with the geometry of the lacing/ eyelets. No matter how tight they are, there is still play in the heel. The tread pattern and sole is amazing, however.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Merrell's the best
customer_reviews.text: Returned to Merrell after trying Keen. Although Keen was very comfortable for pavement, it didn't feel durable and supportive on trails. Also, I was looking for an all black shoe without a lot of contrasting stitching, logos, etc. Hard to find. I've worn these everyday since buying them and I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable hiking shoes. Tracks and grips well without slipping on rocks or other surfaces. These are my first pair of Merrell shoe that I purchased, and they are still very comfortable after multiple long hikes in both desert and cold climates. Note that for me the shoe was somewhat a small fit and had to increase my shoe size from 10 to 11M to fit comfortably. Would purchase again and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Menard

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rugged Shoe for All-Day Wear
customer_reviews.text: Very rugged, very tough and pretty heavy duty shoe for all day city wear and light hiking. Fits like most Merrells do for me - - it feels like contact with the foot is very well distributed and even. Vibram sole offers great traction. Merrell makes a lot of shoes in many different price ranges, and not all of them are as comfortable and supportive as these, which are winners as far as I am concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Sharp One

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes to replace an identical pair that I have worn almost daily for longer than I can remember, at work and after. The soles are a bit stiff but they last a long, long time. In fact the old pair isn't worn out, but the new pair is more comfortable. The only thing I don't like about them is when walking on a hard surface after coming in from the rain they squeak noisily until dry.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: They're ok
customer_reviews.text: Held together for 2 years, but about 3 months in the harder material by the upper inside ankle started working its way through the softer material on both shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Jelly-rific

customer_reviews.title: Merrell makes quality
customer_reviews.text: These are my everyday work shoes. I work as a Telecom Technician for a hospital and I am on my feet most of the day. I spend a good amount of time standing on ladders and crawling around through attics and under floors running cable. I went with Merrell because I have never had a pair that aren't comfortable from day one. These did not disappoint. I will be getting another pair when they wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S.

customer_reviews.title: I will probably only ever wear Merrell from now on.
customer_reviews.text: I love Merrell. I've been wearing their Moab Rover shoe for over six years now. Still have my first pair. They're beat up from a lot of hiking in some incredibly rough places, but still in one piece. I bought these this year because I needed something a little dressier than the trail shoes I had before.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: the merrell standard issue insoles tend to be pretty flat, but I knew that going in
customer_reviews.text: These took a minute to break in, I needed extra insoles, the merrell standard issue insoles tend to be pretty flat, but I knew that going in. Once I broke these in, they fit great, very comfortable, great walking around shoes. And they look good too.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Foot comfort is an important factor when you have been walking this planet for more than seven decades and these shoes seem to meet my parameters.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Conaway

customer_reviews.title: Good but falling apart already.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, love the look like the fit and support but they are falling apart at the bottom most eyelet they are pulling apart. It would be one thing if it was one shoe on one eyelet but it on both shoes and on both bottom eyelets. They have been my regular wear shoe for two and a half months and they have been on three hikes. I expected more from Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: mike mckeever

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work with orthotics
customer_reviews.text: Shoes appeared to have Merrell's typical quality, and had a good fit when using the provided insoles. Unfortunately I have to wear custom orthotics - and these shoes didn't work with them. With the orthotics installed, my feet kept slipping out at the heel. So, back to Amazon they went and I ordered a 2nd pair of Merrell's excellent Moab boots.
customer_reviews.author: anotheroldguy

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! Not sure "rover" is the best description as they are a bit stiff, so, I prefer another shoe for lots of walking and hiking. But these look great and fit well and i expect they will wear well over time, I'm happy to have them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still good, but not better
customer_reviews.text: Second generation of this shoe. Not as good out-of-the box as the first generation, but still a good shoe. This generation is much stiffer and caused some minor bruising on the first extended use. Plan to break them in with several short uses before taking a long trek in them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, Fashion, Protection--all in one
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable. They're Merrells, right? But I've worn Merrells for years now. Nothing this comfortable. Really got it right this time. Fashion. OK, I'm a 56 year old high school teacher. Students tease me about my dated clothing. Day one with these Moab Rovers (Kangaroo) kids were saying, "Nice shoes. Hey, there may be hope for you yet!" Protection--they're waterproof and I can attest to that due to the torrential rains we've had this month. Feet--dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many pairs of shoes by Merrell over the past decade. Not only do they fit well, but I appreciate the durability of their vibran soles. I live in the Sierra Nevada where the granitic soil is tough on your feet and tough on your shoes. When I order shoes online, I know that I can depend on Merrell for comfort and durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Markle

customer_reviews.title: holding up like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these shoes at work almost daily. The tread is getting a little worn but I've had them for 2 years now. Leather uppers are still solid. I would own another pair.
customer_reviews.author: scomcdon

customer_reviews.title: Good fit in wide width - good arch support
customer_reviews.text: Good arch support (could be a little higher, but I have issues -- these are okay). Construction quality seems very good. Sole pattern seems to hold ground well and gives a wide contact. Flex in toe but with good stability mid shoe and a firm support in the heel. I have wide feet and plantar fasciaitis, the width of these is perfect for me and the arch support is "good". I will wear these often and I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Gambler

customer_reviews.title: My son recommended these to me as this is what he wears ...
customer_reviews.text: My son recommended these to me as this is what he wears to work everyday. They are super comfortable and light. My feet can be in them all day without getting tired.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever
customer_reviews.text: I've been through about 5 pairs of Merrell shoes and all of them were very comfortable! Work shoes generally last about 2 years and casual shoes last me about 5 years or more. Never had to replace insoles, had to replace laces on work shoes once. Overall I'm very happy with Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Fandrich

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable until broken in.
customer_reviews.text: This is an update from my initial review. The show was not comfortable at first, but once broken in they are now one of my favorite pairs of shoes. They are well made and have great support and traction for hiking. I still think the insole is a bit hard.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Best show ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite shoe EVER! In fact this is my Second Pair! There's no real break in period on these shoes? You just put them on and go. They're waterproof and have the best grip in the world. It's like you're ready for anything. I'm occupational therapist who used the shoes in the clinical setting and home health and these shoes just worked hard and stayed comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Very good shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy shoes online but these turned out to be very comfortable, light weight, good looking shoes. I'm glad I bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Tom T

customer_reviews.title: Female loves these shoes for casual wear
customer_reviews.text: I am female but need to purchase men's shoes because of my foot shape. I have settled on Merrill's as my go-to brand because I can consistently find size 7 or 71/2 in a style that works for me. I purchased these for casual wear to replace my zillion pairs of black work shoes discarded due to retirement. I like how they look and feel on my feet and I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: liketoshop

customer_reviews.title: Typical Good Quality Merrell
customer_reviews.text: Rated this 4 stars only because I didn't like the style and I returned the shoes. The leather is a rough finish almost like a suede, very course. I was looking for a shoe that would take polish for a more business casual look. The fit was true to size. On a side note, I returned 3 pairs of shoes until I found what I wanted and using Amazon Prime I didn't pay for any of the shipping either way--excellent deal.
customer_reviews.author: lzhome

customer_reviews.title: I have found these shoes to be comfortable from the get go
customer_reviews.text: I have found these shoes to be comfortable from the get go. My feet are not particularly wide, but a bit wide for most of Merrell's shoes in (D). Been wearing them daily for a couple of months now- no complaints at all. Comfy walking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Failure after six months
customer_reviews.text: I like the fit of this shoe but after six months of wear (walking the dog, casual work) the sole of the shoe started wicking water up into my socks whenever I walked on a wet surface. The company did not replace the shoe despite it being under warranty (not “water proof”). Tests with my mom’s casual shoes show her feet remained dry, my “hiking” shoes could not cope.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Kinde

customer_reviews.title: comfortable, looks good
customer_reviews.text: Am a repeat customer and big fan of Merrell. Shoe is well made, comfortable, looks good, and given past history, I expect it to hold up well. Made this specific purchase for a trip to GB, and am going to give the 'waterproof' promise a good test. Will only amend this if it disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Bay

customer_reviews.title: Okay shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have numerous foot issues and am always seeking the perfect shoe. The Rover is not that, but it is a comfortable and well made product. The slip-in insoles provide little support but I always us an after market product. Nice looking casual shoe.
customer_reviews.author: charles barnes

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise they’re perfect. Size was right on
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected, except next time I may purchase something with a little more ankle support. Otherwise they’re perfect. Size was right on. Order what you normally wear. Great quality too. Well made rugged shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Raksnis

customer_reviews.title: fits like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Once again these guys deliver what I asked for. Its always tough to buy shoes and clothing online since we are a bit hesitant that it won't fit. This is my 3rd pair I have bought and once again they fit perfectly. thank you
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Merrell Men's Moab Rover Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Well made, good looking, perfect fit and very comfortable. I do a lot of hiking in and around Sedona, AZ. So far I've used these for hikes through forest and walks around town. Comfortable enough to wear all day. They are also easy to clean after walking a dusty trail. Sometimes my hikes take me across shallow creeks but I haven't tested them for being water proof yet. Would purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: Surprised and pleasantly pleased!
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly they fit really well. I usually try to get them wider bit the shoe that was available was rated as 2E or wide. I read a.previous review of the shoe and that person reaced the inner sole with a gel insert. I did the same, and much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: slc

customer_reviews.title: More Durable than Others, and Quite Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and the leather uppers are much more durable than the fabric walking shoes I've purchased in the past. It does look like the rubber toe shield on the right shoe may be separating a tiny bit but I'm keeping an eye on it.
customer_reviews.author: Dodge DeBoulet

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor.. GET SOME!!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable.. I wear arch supports in my shoes and these Moab Rovers mate with them nicely.. Many shoes are too low on my heel with my supports in them but these are not... Break in peiod was literally about 2 hours.. I walk seveal miles a day at work, after a full week my feet still feel great.. Love these shoes! Update: 11 months later and I was having significant discomfort. I had worn the soles down and worn the shoes out.. ordered a new pair and they are just as awesome as the first pair.. Love these shoes!!
customer_reviews.author: Lacifiret

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably stable platform and comfortable enough for everyday wear
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably stable platform and comfortable enough for everyday wear. Not as comfortable or supportive as my Merrell boots, but get the job done. will definitely be looking at something more supportive before hiking season.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Stouffer

customer_reviews.title: Great casual shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great casual shoe. Very comfortable. Fine to wear with khakis and a button down shirt and sport coat. After receiving this shoe in black and wearing it for a couple of days, I've decided to order it in brown for a little versatility
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Ford

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Just got these for travel after looking at them awhile and reading the reviews. Went up 1/2 size based on experience with Moab Ventilators and the fit is just right. Something to consider for those who have complained of fit. They are made more for function than style but are not bad looking. The Moab design has worked well for Merrell and the Rover appears to continue that success.
customer_reviews.author: Poser906

customer_reviews.title: Rugged/hard soled hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty stiff shoe you do not want to wear on asphalt, concrete or hard surfaces and certainly not for work unless you are in construction or outside in dirt/sod, etc. They are just a good hiking shoe in dirt, rubble and such.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Excellent walking shoe. Used on long distance back packing trips. Best I have found for warm weather hiking. As it is a leather shoe, some water proofing like sno-seal makes it breathable but also water resistant (note, will darken leather).
customer_reviews.author: Mark Rocket

customer_reviews.title: true to fit and comforable
customer_reviews.text: They fit really good. I usually wear a 3X shoe so I was hesitant buying a W but they fit great and are very comfortable right out of the box. I would buy them again......at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: This my husband’s second pair & loves the fit of these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: louellen zarembski

customer_reviews.title: This product feels great while walking and plan to hike a lot this ...
customer_reviews.text: This product feels great while walking and plan to hike a lot this summer and although they feel a little tight brand new I' hoping they will feel even better when broke in. Just a pair of thinner socks will make a big difference this summer and I would recommend ordering a bigger size than you normally wear and happy walking.
customer_reviews.author: tinkerbytrade

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I walk in a production plant all day . 3-5 miles a day . Over a year old . I use leather conditioner ever couple months . No areas of failure.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased were trail/running shoes and they were the most comfortable shoes I've owned
customer_reviews.text: The first pair of Merrell shows I purchased were trail/running shoes and they were the most comfortable shoes I've owned. I decided to try these as casual shows for work and I was not disappointed. They fit as expected (never tried them on anywhere before I ordered them) and they are very comfortable for walking. Great shoe since I purchased them based on the company reputation for excellent shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Shoes felt good from the moment I put them one! I did add another insert under the merrill insert that came with the shoes. The unexpected feature is the ease of putting them on and taking them off. I can slip my foot in without the use of a shoe spoon!
customer_reviews.author: L. M. Herron

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY SHOES THAT FIT
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit soon, but I am highly encouraged. Expect they will be wonderful in cool weather but maybe hot in the summer. So am getting the same brand Catalyst Ventilator for that. My feet are picky and these may become my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS DEY

customer_reviews.title: The sole of these shoes is simply amazing, I can barely believe the grip they have
customer_reviews.text: The sole of these shoes is simply amazing, I can barely believe the grip they have, both the design and material of the sole make it a very safe shoe to walk in. The upper design is very attractive and I love how they look with a pair of jeans, however I'm comfortable wearing them with shorts as well. Another great pair of shoes by Merrell.
customer_reviews.author: agranados777

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, durable.
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable pair of shoes I have ever owned. They definitely get wear and tear, but keep going. 4/5 only because I wish I got the waterproof version. Great for hiking, winter weather, or just everyday shoe. Will buy Merrell again when I have to (I don't think it will be soon).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Got them mainly for work and they look professional enough with khakis for me to wear everyday in my job. They also look good with shorts. I wear 11's in most shoes and got 11's in these and they fit perfectly. Arch is not high and uncomfortable like reviews I've read on some Merrell shoes.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I took these shoes out of the box and hiked/walked over 150 miles in 2 weeks, these things handled mud, water, and snow in the Tirolean alps like a champ. I cannot recommend a better shoe. Merrell for life.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Herbert

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as expected
customer_reviews.text: I am partial to Merrell mainly because of the quality and utility that all their shoes provide. i was looking for a fall weather shoe that was durable but not too heavy or aggressive. The Moab Rover Walking Shoe fit the bill perfectly. The fit was consistent with all my Merrells meaning I am confident ordering the same size for all of them. They feel broken in after a day or two of use and feel very sturdy and well built. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Francis S

customer_reviews.title: The Merrell Moab Rover has become my shoe of choice ...
customer_reviews.text: The Merrell Moab Rover has become my shoe of choice for work. Dressy enough that it can be worn business casual. Rugged enough it can be worn in the field. This was about my 4th pair. I wear them almost every day and get a bit more than a year out of them.
customer_reviews.author: P. S. Ross

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are the best shoes I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the best shoes I have ever owned. Great looking, excellent construction, and incredible support. I wear them pretty muck every day of the year, only switching to OBoz Bridger mids when the activity dictates.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: COMFORT ALL DAY
customer_reviews.text: My feet are Black due to Dye Bleeding from Shoe?? Great Fit , Comfortable. But Not Water Resistant or Proof?
customer_reviews.author: Pezzoperformance

customer_reviews.title: Once again, great shoes from Merrell
customer_reviews.text: I have put a lot of miles in the city and off road and am very happy with these shoes. They are very comfortable and look great. I bought these after my previous pair of Merrell shoes (discontinued) lasted years and held up great. All this combined makes me a big fan of merrel and will keep me a loyal customer.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Blind

customer_reviews.title: Love em.
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing these for a couple of months now. Break in time is longer then normal but I love these shoes. I would buy these exact ones again. Can't go wrong with Merrel
customer_reviews.author: wat3rdog

customer_reviews.title: Seriously NOT disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably good feel right out of the box! I've always liked Merrell shoes and these do not disappoint. And the style was exactly what I was looking for. A subdued (i.e. non-green and orange neon lights) look that is just dressy enough without being a "dress shoe". I could not be more pleased. Thus the 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Doster

customer_reviews.title: Shoes falling apart after less than 5 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these shoes for less than 5 weeks and they are falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Good looking shoe , sizing a bit small
customer_reviews.text: Overall size and width of this model are tight compared with the Phoenix Bluff Merrill shoes I was previously wearing. If ordering these again, I would go up a half size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be broken in
customer_reviews.text: Slightly larger than the size I needed, but comfortable and better with breaking it in.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are great. I work at a car dealership and walk ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. I work at a car dealership and walk all day never have a had an issue. Will buy again after these wear out. 5 months of 12 hour use 5 to 6 days a week and still going strong and comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

product_meta.title: Merrell Men_s Moab Rover Hiking Shoes Durable and Comfortable in Sophisticated Leather Upper and Abrasion Resistant Fabric
product_meta.description: Merrell® brings the best gear; all you have to worry about is bringing the adventure. Low-cut hiking shoe with lace-up closure. Waterproof oily leather upper with textile inserts. Lightweight mesh lining treated with M Select FRESH odor control. Lace-up closure with metallic eyelets. Removable Remember Me Foam™ footbed for increased breathability. 5 mm sole lug depth. Vibram® outsole. Imported. Measurements: Heel Height: 1 1⁄2 in Weight: 15 oz Product measurements were taken using size 9, width M. Please note that measurements may vary by size. Weight of footwear is based on a single item, not a pair.
